statement.tex: \text{Let * be a binary operation, on the set of all} \\ \text{non-zero real numbers, given by } \\ \begin{array}{c} a*b=\dfrac{ab}{5} \text{ for all } a, b\in \mathbb{R} - \{0\} \\ \end{array} \\ \text{Find the value of x, given that }2*(x*5)=10

step.context: a*b\text{ is defined for all } a, b\in \mathbb{R} - \{0\} \\ \text{Is it defined for }a=1.5, b=2?
step.tex: \text{Yes, it is not defined for $a=1.5$ and $b=2$,} \\ \text{since these belong to real numbers.}
\text{No, it is not defined for $a=1.5$, since } \\ \text{$1.5$ does not belong to real numbers.}
step.reason: \text{Real numbers include all rational and} \\ \text{irrational numbers.}
